About Our Platform

Empowering veterans to successfully transition to civilian careers

Our Mission

The Veteran Transition Platform is dedicated to bridging the gap between military service and civilian employment by providing veterans with the tools, resources, and support they need to successfully navigate their career transition.

Every year, thousands of service members transition from military to civilian life. While they possess valuable skills, experience, and work ethic, many struggle to effectively communicate their capabilities to civilian employers. Our platform addresses this challenge by helping veterans translate their military experience into terms that resonate with civilian hiring managers.

Our Approach

We believe that veterans already possess the skills, experience, and work ethic needed to excel in civilian careers. Our platform focuses on helping them effectively communicate their value to employers through:

Skill Translation

Converting military experience, roles, and achievements into civilian-friendly terminology that employers understand and value.

Resume Optimization

Creating professional resumes that effectively communicate veterans' skills and experience in a format that passes ATS screening.

Job Matching

Connecting veterans with civilian roles that align with their military experience, skills, and career goals.

Continuous Learning

Providing resources for skill development and career advancement in civilian sectors.

Our Story

The Veteran Transition Platform was founded in 2020 by a team of veterans and HR professionals who recognized the challenges that service members face when transitioning to civilian careers. Having experienced these challenges firsthand, our founders were determined to create a solution that would make the transition process smoother and more successful for all veterans.

What began as a simple skill translation tool has grown into a comprehensive platform that supports veterans through every stage of their career transition journey. Today, we're proud to have helped over 200,000 veterans successfully transition to civilian careers across various industries.
